headline: Autodesk (ADSK) Launches New Affordable Pricing With AI-Powered Flow Studio Expansion
summary: Autodesk (ADSK) recently launched new pricing for its Flow Studio, including a free tier and a reduced price for its Lite plan, which may have influenced its performance in the market. The company's share price remained flat over the past month, which aligns with the upward momentum of broader market indices like the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, both achieving new record highs due to stable inflation data and hopes for interest rate cuts. The strategic halt in acquiring PTC Inc. aligns with Autodesk's...

headline: PTC Inc. (PTC) Reports Results for Q3; Barclays Lifts PT to $233
summary: With strong share price gains and significant hedge fund interest, PTC Inc. (NASDAQ:PTC) secures a spot on our list of the 11 Hot Software Stocks to Buy Now. On July 31, 2025, Barclays lifted its price target on PTC Inc. (NASDAQ:PTC) from $203 to $233, maintaining an ‘Overweight’ rating. This price revision came a day […]

headline: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From PTC’s Q2 Earnings Call
summary: PTC’s second-quarter results were well received by the market, as the company delivered growth and operating leverage that exceeded Wall Street’s expectations. Management attributed the strong quarter to ongoing adoption of its digital engineering and product lifecycle management platforms, as well as early traction from new AI-driven features. headline: PTC Q2 Deep Dive: AI Integration and Go-to-Market Transformation Drive Outperformance
summary: Engineering and design software provider PTC (NASDAQ:PTC) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 24.2% year on year to $643.9 million. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($755 million at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 5.6% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.64 per share was 35.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
